1. Draw the graph of a function from your imagination over the domain $x \in [-5, 5]$. The function should be continuous everywhere *except at $x = -2, 1, 3$.

2. Draw the graph of a function from your imagination over the domain $x \in [-5,5]$. The function should be continuous everywhere in $[-5,5]$. It should also have a derivative everywhere except at $x = -2, 1, 3$.
